JobTitle: Lead Requirements and Analysis Engineer- Orlando, Florida
JobFullDesc: Description:Lockheed Martin's Missiles and Fire Control business is experiencing some substantial growth at our campus in sunny Orlando, FL.  We are seeking a Systems Engineer (SE) to serve as the IRAD PI overseeing the technical development of subsystems for a new weapon system.  You will lead a team of design and test engineers, and may include providing Integration and Test leadership to other IRAD activities and work across IPTs to support a fully interconnected system design. You will manage both the technical scope of internal and subcontractor design, development, and test. You must have an active SECRET security clearance with an investigation performed within the past 5 years to be considered for this role and all work must be done onsite.Relocation:  Relocation assistance is possible for this exciting position. Learn more about Lockheed Martin’s comprehensive benefits package.Basic Qualifications:Familiarity with subsystem development, as well as experience with requirements analysis and derivation, and test planning/execution. You must have the ability to perform the following tasks:• Perform requirements definition of achievable design characteristics for an objective system.• Synthesize design characteristics into an implemental system architecture.• Flow system level requirements to testable structures and modular hardware and software using DOORS.• Perform trade studies and Risk and Opportunity Management analyses.• Define and track Technical Performance Measures (TPM's).• Perform detail system verification activities including definition of verification methodology.• Generate and execute a Systems Engineering Management Plan (SEMP).• Define system tolerances and timelines.• Conduct a thorough functional configuration audit with verification evidence provided.Candidate must currently hold a Secret clearance with a background investigation within the last 5 years.Desired Skills:• Demonstrate a strong fundamental understanding of RF systems, electromagnetics concepts, and associated performance modeling• Understanding and experience in antenna measurements• Assist in the flow down of radar requirements to testable modular hardware and software• Demonstrate mastery of simulation and analysis tools (e.g., MATLAB)BASIC QUALIFICATIONS:job.QualificationsLockheed Martin is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer.
